english: "Hey, uh, so yesterday, I ate the chocolate Tom had in the fridge, and he got really mad at me, but don't you think he kind of overreacted?" japanese: 誰かが私の名前を呼んでる。
english: Someone's calling my name.

japanese: この学生さん、達筆ね。
english: This student has beautiful handwriting.

japanese: 隅っこに置いといて。
english: Put it in the corner.

japanese: 角に置いといて。
english: Put it in the corner.

japanese: 彼女スリムね。
english: She's slim.

japanese: 朝飯前だよ。
english: It's as easy as can be.

japanese: ここでは、レタス・キャベツ・セロリなどの高原野菜を栽培しています。
english: Tableland vegetables are grown here, such as lettuce, cabbage, and celery.

japanese: 修学旅行は、志賀高原にスキーに行きました。
english: We went skiing in Shiga Kogen for our school trip.

japanese: 昔はもっと創造性豊かだったんだけどね。
english: I used to be more creative.

japanese: トムがそれを終わらせるには、あと２・３日はかかるな。
english: Tom needs a couple more days to finish doing that.

japanese: 他に見たいものある？
english: Is there anything else you want to see?

japanese: メアリーの奇抜なドレスは、パーティー会場で一際目立っていた。
english: Mary's eccentric dress stood out in the crowd at the party space.

japanese: パスタをズルズルと音立てながら食べるのはやめなさい。
english: Stop making that slurping noise when you eat your pasta.

japanese: おはよう、今アイスあるよ。
english: Good morning, right now I have ice cream.

japanese: もうパソコンは落としたよ。
english: I've already turned off my computer.

japanese: もうパソコンの電源は落としたよ。
english: I've already turned off my computer.

japanese: もうパソコンは切ったよ。
english: I've already turned off my computer.

japanese: もうパソコンの電源は切ったよ。
english: I've already turned off my computer.

japanese: トムって、コーヒー依存症だよね？
english: Tom is dependent on coffee, isn't he?

japanese: トムって、カフェイン依存症だよね？
english: Tom has a caffeine dependency, doesn't he?

japanese: メアリーは彼の肩にそっと手を置いた。
english: Mary gently placed her hand on his shoulder.

japanese: 地図が欲しいから、ちょっと本屋に寄っていい？
english: I want a map, so do you mind if we drop by the bookstore for a bit?

japanese: 地図が買いたいから、ちょっと本屋に寄っていい？
english: I want to buy a map, so do you mind if we drop by the bookstore for a bit?

japanese: いつかは死ぬが、いつ死ぬかは分からない。
english: Someday, I will die, but I do not know when that day will be.

japanese: トムの新車は時速140キロ出るんだよ。
english: Tom's new car can do 140 kilometres per hour.

japanese: 気に入ってもらえるわよ。
english: I'm sure they'll like it.

japanese: 「モデルさん？それとも女優？」「いいえ。ただの学生です」
english: "Are you a model? Or an actress?" "No. I'm just a student."

japanese: 梱包は潰れてたけど、中身は無事だったよ。
english: The packaging was crushed, but the contents were ok.

japanese: 年中無休です。
english: It's open every day of the year.

japanese: 365日営業してます。
english: We are operating 365 days a year.

japanese: 年中休まず営業中！
english: Open all year round!

japanese: ここの正式名称は何ですか？
english: What is the official name for this place?

japanese: 「薬指」は「お姉さん指」とも言います。
english: In Japanese, the ring finger can also be referred to as "the older-sister finger".

japanese: 今日は、水泳でいい汗流したな。
english: Today, I worked up a good sweat swimming.

japanese: 猫は日向ぼっこが好きなんだよ。
english: Cats like to sunbathe.

japanese: 薬のおかげで楽になったよ。
english: Thanks to the medicine, I feel better now.

japanese: 「今度、子供たちに英語を教えることになったんだけど、嬉しい反面、緊張する。上手く喋れるかな」「すごいじゃん。少々失敗しても、ご愛敬ってことで大丈夫よ。自信もって頑張ってね！」
english: "So, I'll be teaching the kids English next time, and while I'm really happy, on the other hand, I'm nervous. I wonder if I'll be able to speak it well?" "That's great! Even if you mess up here and there, it'll just be endearing, so it's fine. Be confident, and do your best!"

japanese: うちのおばあちゃん、園芸にたけてるのよ。
english: My grandmother has green fingers.

japanese: バスは15分おきに出ます。
english: A bus leaves every fifteen minutes.

japanese: メアリーは一人になりがっていた。
english: Mary wanted to be alone.

japanese: 1人で行くように勧めたんだけどね。
english: I suggested she go there alone.

japanese: このビーチパラソルは、トムから借りたんだ。
english: I borrowed this beach umbrella from Tom.

japanese: これから、トムと同じようにしましょうね。
english: From now on, let's do this the same way that Tom does.

japanese: 最近、筋トレやってなくてさ、筋肉が落ちちゃったんだ。
english: Recently, I haven't been working out, so I've lost a bit of muscle.

japanese: トムってさ、虫歯だらけなんだよ。
english: Tom has a lot of cavities.

japanese: この本は何ページあるんですか？
english: How many pages are there in this book?

japanese: 一日中寝てました。
english: I stayed in bed all day.

japanese: このバケツ、穴があいてるんだ。
english: This bucket's got a hole in it.

japanese: 管理人に聞いてみて。
english: Ask an administrator.

japanese: 旦那さんとお子さんがいらっしゃるのよ。
english: She has a husband and kids.

japanese: 「何か飲みますか？」「いえ、結構です」
english: "Do you want anything to drink?" "No, thanks."

japanese: 「ベジタリアンなの？」「ううん。あなたは？」
english: "Are you a vegetarian?" "No. Are you?"

japanese: あの箱の中、何が入ってた？
english: What did you find in that box?

japanese: 初めて乗った車は、日産のパルサーです。
english: My first car was a Nissan Pulsar.

japanese: 何問答えた？
english: How many questions did you answer?

japanese: ソファーの上に雑誌が転がっていた。
english: Magazines were lying on the couch.

japanese: この写真、削除してもらえますか？
english: Can you delete this photo?

japanese: 食卓には鉛筆が二本あります。
english: There are two pencils on the table.

japanese: テーブルの上に鉛筆が２本あります。
english: There are two pencils on the table.

japanese: このネクタイ、お前のスーツの20倍以上するんだぞ。
english: This tie costs twenty times more than your suit.

japanese: 今日は遠足なので、うちの子は張り切って出かけた。
english: Our child enthusiastically set out today since we're going on a trip.

japanese: トムはハムスターを飼っています。
english: Tom has a hamster.

japanese: 日本語できる人知ってますか？
english: Do you know anyone who speaks Japanese?

japanese: この道路は通行止めです。
english: This road is closed to traffic.

japanese: この道路は通行止めになっています。
english: This road is closed to traffic.

japanese: どんな映画ですか。
english: What kind of movie is it?

japanese: 同じミスをしないように注意しましょう。
english: Be careful not to make the same mistake again.

japanese: その本、学生の頃に読んだ記憶があるよ。
english: I remember reading that book when I was a student.

japanese: 仕事なんか大嫌い。行きたくな〜い。
english: Ugh, I hate work. I don't wanna go.

japanese: メアリーとアリスは二人とも妊娠してるんだ。
english: Mary and Alice are both expecting babies.

japanese: あほくさい人って、ヤダ。
english: I hate stupid people.

japanese: 次はもう少し頑張らないとダメだぞ。
english: You'll have to try a bit harder next time.

japanese: フランス語を教えてくれてありがとう。
english: Thank you for teaching me French.

japanese: フランス語を教えてくださってありがとうございました。
english: Thank you for teaching me French.

japanese: 「猫はどこなの？」「屋根の上だよ」
english: "Where's the cat?" "It's on the roof."

japanese: トムは車に銃を積んでいる。
english: Tom has a gun in his car.

japanese: 昆虫採集にハマってます。
english: I'm into collecting insects.

japanese: これは後で詳しく見ておきます。
english: I'll take a closer look at this later.

japanese: これは後でよく見ときます。
english: I'll take a closer look at this later.

japanese: 言いそびれてたんだけど、私のこと呼び捨てでいいからね。
english: Oh, I missed the chance to tell you, but you can just call me by my normal name, by the way.

japanese: 「どれぐらいいるの？」「２週間ぐらい」
english: "How long will you be staying?" "About a fortnight."

japanese: カロリーが高すぎるよ。
english: It's too high in calories.

japanese: 何も見てないし、何も聞こえなかったよ。
english: I saw nothing and heard nothing.

japanese: この本を読んでみたらいいと思うよ。
english: I think it'd be good if you read this book.

japanese: すぐふざけるんだから。真面目に聞いてよ。
english: You always start making jokes. I really want you to listen seriously.

japanese: トムは練習が必要だな。
english: Tom needs to practice.

japanese: ミュージアムは、修復作業のため休館中です。
english: The museum is closing for restorations.

japanese: よく見られる症状です。
english: It's a common symptom.

japanese: よくある症状です。
english: It's a common symptom.

japanese: バナナとチョコって、相性抜群よね。
english: Bananas and chocolate go well together, don't they?

japanese: この荷物をトラックに載せたいんだけど、手伝ってくれない？
english: I want to get this luggage in the truck. Do you think you could help me?

japanese: この荷物をトラックに載せるの手伝って。
english: Help me get this luggage into the truck.

japanese: イメージが崩れるから、しゃべらない方がいいよ。
english: You should just stop talking. You're only going to make yourself look worse.

japanese: 帽子をかぶると髪型が崩れるから嫌なのよ。
english: I don't like wearing hats because it messes up my hair.

japanese: 人前で頭をなでなでするのはやめて。恥ずかしいでしょ。
english: Stop petting their head when you're in front of people. Don't you think it's embarrassing for them?

japanese: そんなに頑張ったら、体調崩すよ。
english: If you work that hard, you're going to burn out.

japanese: たまには休まないと、体調を崩すよ。
english: If you don't rest once in a while, you'll get sick.

japanese: 折角ここまで頑張って積み上げたのに、もう崩すの？もったいない！
english: After all that effort to build it up, you're already going to knock it down? What a waste!

japanese: お母さんが雨戸を開けるガタガタという音で目が覚めた。
english: I woke up at the rattling sound of my mom opening the shutters.

japanese: この雨戸もそろそろ取り替え時ね。
english: It's about time to replace these shutters.

japanese: 雨戸を取り替えることにしたんだ。
english: I've decided to replace the shutters.

japanese: いちいちうるさいな！
english: I wish you'd stop being so fussy!

japanese: 2の5乗は32です。
english: Two to the power of five equals thirty-two.

japanese: 大学では、認知科学を専攻するつもりです。
english: I'm majoring in cognitive science in college.

japanese: ジリは朝食のテーブルに着いた。
english: Ziri was sitting at the breakfast table.

japanese: トムにはっきり言ってやったわ。「酔っ払いの相手はできません！」ってね。
english: I said it straight to Tom's face! "I can't talk to you if you're drunk."

japanese: 今夜はシャワーにしよっと。
english: I'm having a shower tonight.

japanese: 太朗は、３日間日本にいました。
english: Taro stayed in Japan for three days.

japanese: 太郎は、3日間日本に滞在した。
english: Taro stayed in Japan for three days.

japanese: 買い物、いつ行くの？
english: When are you going shopping?

japanese: 事故は交差点で起きました。
english: The accident happened at a junction.

japanese: 下の名前で呼んでいいよ。
english: You may call me by my first name.

japanese: この机は、私にはちょっと低すぎる。
english: This desk is a bit too low for me.

japanese: 午前中はずっと手紙を書いていた。
english: I spent the whole morning writing letters.

japanese: コートはどこに掛けたの？
english: Where did you hang your coat?

japanese: 今はそれどころじゃないよ。
english: Now's not the time for that.

japanese: そのお話が聞きたいだけです。
english: I just want to hear the story.

japanese: 女って、どうしてプレゼントに弱いんだ？
english: Why are women so weak to presents?

japanese: 現金なヤツめ。
english: He appears to be a self-interested person.

japanese: 現金な人ね。
english: A calculative person, aren't they.

japanese: それはもう問題じゃないよ。
english: That isn't a problem anymore.

japanese: それはもう問題ないね。
english: That isn't a problem anymore.

japanese: 流行に流されないことにしたわ。
english: I've decided to not be swayed by the trends.

japanese: これは、私にとっては大打撃よ。
english: This has hit me hard.

japanese: 手伝いたくないんだったら、そう言えばいいじゃん。
english: If you don't want to help, just say so.

japanese: イメチェンすることにした。
english: I decided to change my image.

japanese: 何とかしてそこへ早く着いて。
english: Try your best to get there early.

japanese: 前から、これやってみたかったのよ。
english: I've always wanted to try this.

japanese: バンジージャンプ、やってみたかったのよ。
english: I've always wanted to try bungee jumping.

japanese: 「このベジタリアンのお店、美味しそうじゃない？ねぇ、今日行ってみようよ」「俺、肉が食べたいんだけど」「えっ、昨日、焼肉食べてなかった？」「昨日は昨日、今日は今日。それに俺、肉なら毎日でも食べれるし」「もういい。違う人、誘う。じゃぁね」
english: "Doesn't this vegetarian restaurant look good? Let’s try it today!" "I'm in the mood for meat, though." "But didn’t we have yakiniku yesterday?" "Yesterday was yesterday; today is today. Besides, I could eat meat every day." "Forget it. I'll ask someone else. See you later."

japanese: スキューバダイビング、やってみたかったのよ。
english: I've always wanted to try scuba diving.

japanese: 箱の中身を見せてください。
english: Please show us what you have in the box.

japanese: 私の眼鏡に何したの？
english: What've you done with my glasses?

japanese: 大阪に滞在中です。
english: I'm staying in Osaka.

japanese: 「普段、お菓子って、買って食べたりする？」「自分ではあまり買わないけど、オフィスにいつもいろんなお菓子が置いてあるから、たまに食べるよ」
english: "Do you usually buy snacks and eat them?" "Well, I don't buy them myself a lot, but there's always all these snacks lying around in the office, so I eat them once in a while."

japanese: これは、食用きのこです。
english: This is an edible mushroom.

japanese: これは、食べれるキノコです。
english: This is an edible mushroom.

japanese: これはオリジナルです。
english: This is the original.

japanese: これは原本です。
english: This is the original.

japanese: これが元祖よ。
english: This is the original.

japanese: トムは1週間、病気で寝込んでたんだ。
english: Tom was sick in bed for a week.

japanese: このワンちゃん、泳げるの？
english: Can this dog swim?

japanese: 雨が降るかもしれないから、傘持っていきなよ。
english: It might rain, so take an umbrella.

japanese: 夏休みなんてあっという間さ。
english: Summer vacation goes away in the blink of an eye.

japanese: 日本語って、厄介な言語だと思うよ。
english: I think that Japanese is a really difficult language.

japanese: 「ピザなしで生きていける？」「うん。私は大丈夫。へっちゃらよ」
english: "Would you be able to live without pizza?" "Yeah. I'd be fine. I'd be totally unfazed."

japanese: 君は髪が灰色になっている。
english: Your hair is going grey.

japanese: 白髪になってきたわね。
english: Your hair is going grey.

japanese: どうして誰も質問しないの？
english: Why does no one ask questions?

japanese: 学校では、読み・書き・そろばんを習います。
english: At school, we're taught reading, writing and arithmetic.

japanese: 学校では、読んだり、書いたり、計算することを教わります。
english: At school, we're taught reading, writing and arithmetic.

japanese: コップの水は濁ってる。
english: The water in the glass is cloudy.

japanese: ニューヨーク州からオハイオ州まで毎日通ってるの？
english: You've been commuting between New York and Ohio every day?

japanese: 私は、大学まで車で通っています。
english: I commute to college via car.

japanese: 4月10日から仕事に通うことになります。
english: I'll begin going to work starting April 10th.

japanese: 寝ることにするよ。くたくたなんだ。
english: I'll say goodnight. I'm dead on my feet.

japanese: ゆっくり見てね。
english: Look at it in your own time.

japanese: 名前を書き間違えられた。
english: He spelled my name wrong.

japanese: トムって、帽子いくつ持ってるの？
english: How many caps does Tom have?

japanese: 日本にはいつ来るの？
english: When are you coming to Japan?

japanese: 俺の師匠は悠々自適の生活をしている。
english: My master is living a life free from worldly cares.

japanese: 二人とも運転できないんです。
english: Neither of us can drive.

japanese: トムは運転できないし、メアリーもできないよ。
english: Tom can't drive, and Mary can't either.

japanese: 私がこんなに緊張するとは思わなかった。
english: I didn't think I'd be so nervous.

japanese: もう、僕がトイレ使う番だよ。
english: It's my turn to use the bathroom.

japanese: 日本語を入力する時って、ひらがな入力してる？それともローマ字入力？
english: When you type in Japanese, are you using hiragana input, or romaji input?

japanese: 招待状はもう出したよ。
english: We've already sent out the invitations.

japanese: 僕はちっぽけな男さ。
english: I'm just a little guy.

japanese: 火山噴火によって、多くの人が避難を余儀なくされた。
english: Because of the volcanic eruption, many people were forced to evacuate.

japanese: 買ったばかりのコーヒーを全部こぼしちゃった。
english: I completely spilled the coffee I just bought.

japanese: なんだか胸がムカムカするんだ。薬もってる？
english: I feel like puking. Do you have any medicine?

japanese: トムは地図を折り畳み、グローブボックスに戻した。
english: Tom folded the map and put it back in the glove compartment.

japanese: ハチミツ、レモン果汁、ローストアーモンドとすりおろしたリンゴを加えます。
english: Add the honey, lemon juice, roasted almonds and grated apple.

japanese: 蜂蜜・レモン汁・ローストしたアーモンド・すりおろし林檎を加えます。
english: Add the honey, lemon juice, roasted almonds and grated apple.

japanese: 塩・胡椒で味を調え、ナツメグを一つまみ加えましょう。
english: Season with salt and pepper and add a pinch of nutmeg.

japanese: 塩コショウして、ナツメグを一つまみ加えます。
english: Season with salt and pepper and add a pinch of nutmeg.

japanese: 誰か、キャラメルマカロンの作り方教えてくれない？
english: Who can give me a recipe for caramel macarons?

japanese: 今日の夕飯は、お魚づくしよ。
english: Today's dinner is all kinds of fish.

japanese: トムとメアリーは何を話してるのかな。
english: I wonder what Tom and Mary are talking about.

japanese: 姉は大の子供好きなんです。
english: My sister loves children.

japanese: トムは首が太いんだ。
english: Tom has a thick neck.

japanese: 他に買いたいものある？
english: Is there anything else you want to buy?

japanese: トムのユニフォームには血がついていた。
english: There was blood on Tom's uniform.

japanese: おもらしじゃなくて、ズボンに全部水こぼしちゃったよ。
english: I didn't pee myself. I just spilled water all over my pants.

japanese: 入社して何年目？
english: How many years have you been with this company?

japanese: この会社に入社して、何年になりますか？
english: How many years have you been with this company?

japanese: フロントガラスは、粉々に割れた。
english: The front windscreen was smashed to pieces.

japanese: 朝食はピザがいいな。
english: I like to eat pizza for breakfast.

japanese: 彼はコーヒーを飲み終え、支払いを済ませた。
english: He finished his coffee and paid the bill.

japanese: ネイティブに聞いてみた方がいいんじゃないかな？
english: Shouldn't you ask that to a native speaker?

japanese: 私はあなたの反科学的貧困を十分に経験しました。
english: I've had enough of your anti-science poverty.

japanese: 私のお母さんは厳しいけど、お父さんはそんなことないよ。
english: My mother is strict, but my father isn't.

japanese: 私の親は二人とも、厳しくないよ。
english: Neither of my parents is strict with me.

japanese: 俺の親二人とも俺に厳しいんだ。
english: Both of my parents are strict with me.

japanese: 外は雪が降っていました。
english: It was snowing outside.

japanese: 幸せ者だった。
english: I was a happy man.

japanese: どうしていつもドアを開けっ放しにしてるの？
